headline: This free online course covers the psychology and abilities affecting the cognitive development of young children.

It also looks at cognitive psychology, including thinking and reasoning, creativity, intelligence and the Stanford-Binet Intelligence Scale. We will help you answer questions like 'how can you measure intelligence?' or ‘what was the first intelligence test?'. Register today!

courseDescription:
‘Cognitive development’ is the sum of all the small and significant changes to our brains as we learn to think and work things out for ourselves as we grow. This course begins by studying the layout of cognitive and social development in early childhood, including the mental processes involved. In addition, you can explore cognitive assessment by examining the Stanford-Binet Intelligence Test. Before we explore the Leiter International Performance Scale, we will demonstrate the benefits of supporting cognitive development in early childhood.

The course then explores the roles and duties associated with using cognitive development theories. It will teach you how to analyze information about social-emotional development in early childhood. Finally, we will help you investigate the theories and practical ways you can handle social anxiety and social phobia. We will research early childhood social skills training. This course will also examine social developmental delays. It will help you answer questions like ‘what is a Cognitive Assessment?’ or ‘what are some cognitive development theories’.

This course will teach you how to examine cognitive and social development in early childhood. We provide precise functions and essential foundations so you can confidently use them in your workplace. This course is ideal for understanding cognitive and social development in early childhood. So enroll now and study the essentials of early childhood's mental and social development.
